title: Quotient Rule of Exponents
text: For any real number a and natural numbers $$m$$ and $$n$$, such that $$m>n$$, the quotient rule of exponents states that $$\frac{a^m}{a^n}=a^{m-n}$$
speech: For any real number a and natural numbers  m  and  n , such that  m is greater than n , the quotient rule of exponents states that  fraction, a to the m-th, over, a to the n-th,  is equal to, a raised to the m minus n power

, such that   m is greater than n
, the quotient rule of exponents states that   fraction, a to the m-th, over, a to the n-th,  is equal to, a raised to the m minus n power

title: Quotient Rule of Exponents
text: Use the quotient rule to simplify the expression: $$\frac{{\left({de}^2\right)}^{11}}{{2\left({de}^2\right)}^{11}}=\frac{1}{2} {\left({de}^2\right)}^{11-11}=\frac{1}{2} {\left({de}^2\right)}^0$$
speech: Use the quotient rule to simplify the expression:  fraction, parentheses d e squared,  to the eleventh, over, 2 times, parentheses d e squared,  to the eleventh,  is equal to 1 half times parentheses d e squared,  raised to the 11 minus 11 power is equal to 1 half times, parentheses d e squared,  to the 0

title: Zero Exponent Rule
text: For any nonzero real number a, the zero exponent rule of exponents states that $$a^0=1$$
speech: For any nonzero real number a, the zero exponent rule of exponents states that , a to the 0 is equal to 1,
pacedSpeech: For any nonzero real number a, the zero exponent rule of exponents states that  , a to the 0 is equal to 1,

title: Simplify
text: Use the Zero Exponent Rule to simplify the expression: $$\frac{1}{2} {\left({de}^2\right)}^0=1\frac{1}{2}$$
speech: Use the Zero Exponent Rule to simplify the expression:  1 half times, parentheses d e squared,  to the 0 is equal to, 1 and 1 half
